FuncDef:
The flag space-padding disable command disables the function of automatically padding spaces at the end of the flag j0/j1/j2 16-byte or 64-byte mode on a low-speed CPOS interface.
The undo flag space-padding disable command restores the default setting.
By default, the flag j0, j1, and j2 are padded with spaces.
ExtraInfo: When flag j0/j1/j2 16-byte or 64-byte mode is configured on a low-speed CPOS interface of a Huawei device, if the length of flag j0/j1/j2 is insufficient, spaces are automatically added at the end of the flag. If the peer non-Huawei device does not automatically pad spaces in flag j0, j1, and j2 by default, the Huawei device reports a tim alarm. To solve this problem, run the padded-space command to enable the system to automatically add spaces to the end of j0, j1, and j2.
